clinical_study.brief_title: External Drainage Versus Internal Drainage of Pancreatic Duct With a Stent After Pancreaticoduodenectomy (EDIDPD)
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study of External Drainage Versus Internal Drainage of Pancreatic Duct With a Stent

lead_sponsor.agency: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

clinical_study.source: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Postoperative pancreatic fistula (POPF) and other surgical complications are common after pancreatoduodenectomy (PD) and POPF is a major complication. The drainage of pancreatic duct is important and a stent is usually placed in the operation, but it is still controversial whether the stent drainage is internal or external.

detailed_description.textblock: The current study is to compare the rate of Postoperative pancreatic fistula(POPF) and other surgical complications after pancreatoduodenectomy (PD).

primary_outcome.measure: the rate of Postoperative pancreatic fistula within 2 weeks after operation
primary_outcome.description: Postoperative pancreatic fistula (POPF) is defined as a drain output of any measurable volume of fluid on or after postoperative day 3 with an amylase content greater than 3 times the serum amylase activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: the rate of postoperative Surgical Complications
secondary_outcome.description: the rate of Postpancreatectomy hemorrhage(PPH);Delayed gastric emptying (DGE); Bile leakage after pancreatic surgery;Anastomotic leakage

clinical_study.condition: Complications of Surgical and Medical Care: General Terms

arm_group.description: External Drainage of pancreatic duct was used in PD.

the Intervention name is: Internal Drainage of Pancreatic Duct after pancreatomy, a stent was placed in the pancreatic duct, external drainage of the stent is defined as control group(the stent will be tans-abdomen and as a drainage of pancreatic fluid), and internal drainage of the stent is defined as interventional(or experimental) group, with the stent very short(2cm) and placed in jejunum.

intervention.intervention_name: Internal Drainage of Pancreatic Duct after pancreatomy
intervention.description: the Intervention name is: Internal Drainage of Pancreatic Duct after pancreatomy, a stent was placed in the pancreatic duct, external drainage of the stent is defined as control group(the stent will be tans-abdomen and as a drainage of pancreatic fluid), and internal drainage of the stent is defined as interventional(or experimental) group, with the stent very short(2cm) and placed in jejunum.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age more than 18 years.
- Received pancreatoduodenectomy.
- Informed consent has been signed.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age less than 18 years
- Emergency surgery
- Past history of pancreatic surgery.
